official-title.#text:
To require the Attorney General to issue rules pertaining to the collection and compilation of data
			 on the use of deadly force by law enforcement officers.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Statistics on Deadly Force Transparency Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Statistics on Deadly Force Transparency Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in
			 consultation with stakeholders, including Federal, State, and local law
			 enforcement agencies and community, professional, research, and civil
			 rights organizations, shall issue regulations for the collection and
			 compilation of data pertaining to the use of deadly force by Federal,
			 State, or local law enforcement officers.

text.#text: Not later than 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act, the
The regulations issued under subsection (a) shall—

require the collection of data on all instances wherein deadly force was used by a Federal, State,
			 or local law enforcement officer;
require that the data collected shall—

include identifying characteristics of the person who was the target of the use of deadly force and
			 the officer who used deadly force, including—
race or ethnicity;
gender;
approximate age; and
the actual or perceived religious affiliation;
include the date, time, and location of such use of deadly force;
include the alleged criminal activity of the person who was the target of the use of deadly force;
include the nature of the deadly force used, including the use of a firearm;

include an explanation, if any, from the relevant law enforcement agency on why deadly force was
			 used;

include a copy of any use of deadly force guidelines in effect at the relevant law enforcement
			 agency at the time deadly force was used;

include a description of any non-lethal efforts employed to apprehend or subdue the person who was
			 the target of the use of deadly force before deadly force was used; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Statistics on Deadly Force Transparency Act of 2014/s:4

text.#text: not include personally identifiable information described in

provide that a standardized form shall be made available to law enforcement agencies for the
			 submission of data collected pursuant to this Act to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and any other component of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Department of Justice Bureau of
			 Justice Statistics

text.#text:
require that law enforcement agencies compile data using the standardized form made available under
			 paragraph (3), and submit the form to the

require that law enforcement agencies shall maintain all data collected under this Act for not less
			 than 4 years.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Department of Justice Bureau of Justice Statistics

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and make available
			 to the public the data collected pursuant to this Act, excluding any
			 personally identifiable information described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Statistics on Deadly Force Transparency Act of 2014/s:4

text.#text: The

header.#text: Duties of the bureau of justice statistics

text.#text:
The name or identifying information of a law enforcement officer, person who was the target of the
			 use of deadly force, or any other individual involved in any activity for
			 which data is collected and compiled under this Act shall not be—
released to the public;
disclosed to any person, except for—
such disclosures as are necessary to comply with this Act;
disclosures of information regarding a particular person to that person; or
disclosures pursuant to litigation; or
subject to disclosure under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, except for disclosures of information
			 regarding a particular person to that person.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Statistics on Deadly Force Transparency Act of 2014/s:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall reduce the amount that would
			 otherwise be awarded to that State or unit of local government under such
			 grant program in the following fiscal year by 10 percent.

text.#text: In the case of a State or unit of local government that received a grant award under
